info.title: OB OpenAPI Taxonomy
info.description: OB OpenAPI Definitions For Orange Button.

EnergyMeasurement.description: A value of energy produced in one time period related to a device.

EnergyPrediction.description: A value of energy produced in one time period.

EnergyModel.description: Energy model contains energy predictions and information about the model assumptions and information sources.

EnergyProduction.description: Actual Energy Production at a System Site.

AuthorityHavingJurisdiction.description: The authority having jurisdiction over any permit, site, or governance decision

EngineeringReviewRequirement.description: A review by a single engineer or other professional of a design or drawing set

Site.description: The site of a solar installation or potential solar installation

allOf.description: Name of the city in the physical or mailing address.
State of a Province of the mailing or physical address.
Zip Code / Postal Code of a mailing or physical address.
ISO country code where system is located.
Decimal value of latitude of the physical site in degrees.  Positive North of the Equator.  Negative South of the Equator
Decimal value of longitude of the physical site in degrees.  Positive east of the Prime Meridian.  Negative west of the Prime Meridian.  North America is negative..
County of the physical or mailing address
Email address
Phone Number of a cell phone or mobile device.  This phone is expected to be able to receive text messages.  Characters like hyphen, period, x for extension are allowed.
Phone number to be used during working hours.  Characters like hyphen, period, x for extension are allowed.
Phone number to be used for high priority calls only.  Characters like hyphen, period, x for extension are allowed.
First name of a person.
Middle name of a person.
The last name of person.
The height of ground level at a location relative to sea level.

Location.description: A location is defined by Latitude, Longitude and Altitude.

allOf.description: Height from ground level.
First line of a mailing or physical address.
Second line of a mailing or physical address.
Third line of a mailing or physical address.
Type of design/energy production model for the PV system which could be Pvsyst, SAM, PV Watts, or Other.

A filename holding the configuration details of the energy prediction details. This could be a zip file containing multiple files. The intention is to be able to reproduce the energy predictions if needed.
Generic Text field used in fields to provide more detail

x-ob-sample-value.Value: A description for generic commentary on a object. Not intended for machine analysis

allOf.description: The applicable building code the AHJ enforces.
Notes for special requirements related to the building code in this AHJ.

x-ob-sample-value.Value: Locally denoted as the 2018 state code

allOf.description: The applicable residential code the AHJ enforces.
The applicable fire code the AHJ enforces.
The applicable electric code the AHJ enforces.
Notes for special requirements related to the residential code in this AHJ.

x-ob-sample-value.Value: Locally denoted as the 2018 state code

allOf.description: Notes for special requirements related to the fire code in this AHJ.

x-ob-sample-value.Value: Locally denoted as the 2018 state code

allOf.description: Notes for special requirements related to the electric code in this AHJ.

x-ob-sample-value.Value: Locally denoted as the 2018 state code

allOf.description: The method for submitting AHJ documents.
Notes about the document submission process for this AHJ.

x-ob-sample-value.Value: The documents need to be submitted in PDF format with everything combined into a single document

allOf.description: The type of engineering or professional review
The type of certifying stamp that is applied to the design or drawing set
Name of the Authority Having Jurisdiction
This field indicates if this instance of an object is required or optional. Conditionally optional the conditions can be described in RequirementNotes.
Method of the determining the location
The type of contact being specified
The method of contact the contact prefers
The identifier of the location.
The identifier of the address.
The identifier of the contact.
The timezone where the contact is located.
The type of location being specified
A generic URL to a file folder for transmitting documents
A URL string
The type of address being specified
The name of a task
The status of a task
The price of the PV system

EnergyUsage.description: A value of energy consumed in one time period

EnergyConsumption.description: The energy consumption history of a site

allOf.description: Identifier of the system
Capacity in DC at Standard Test Conditions
Quantity of a Product

ProdLineItem.description: A product used within a PVSystem and the quantity of that product

allOf.description: The projected savings to the consumer from reduced electricity demand over a period of time.
The status of the operation of the PVSystem
The status of the operation of the PVSystem
The type of product.  Clarifying Notes:  A Combiner Box takes DC and moves to AC while a CombinerPanel combines AC Loads.

BillOfMaterials.description: Bill of Materials for a System

allOf.description: The status of the BillOfMaterials
The title of the contact
The notes about the requirement level of the engineering review

x-ob-sample-value.Value: The structural engineering stamp is only required for houses built before 1990

allOf.description: The date the task was completed
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Use EndTime for the actual completed date. StartTime should be the task start date

allOf.description: The type of Structure
The type of roof of the structure

SeismicLoad.description: The combined parameters for the Seismic Load condition of a structural design

allOf.description: MCER ground motion (period=0.2s)
MCER ground motion (period=1.0s)
The ID of the structure
The identifier of the electrical service system

ElectricalService.description: A electrical service of a site

allOf.description: The extreme low temperature for the wire sizing calculations
The 2% high temperature for the wire sizing calculations
The risk category from ASCE7
The wind code adopted by the authority having jurisdiction
The rating of the main electrical service breaker
The notes about the wind code if there are special requirements

x-ob-sample-value.Value: This area uses the wind code from the department of insurance rather than the ASCE codes.

allOf.description: The UUID of the task
The year the structure was built

HomeownersAssociation.description: The Homeowner's Association of a site

allOf.description: The name of the homeowner's association
The type of foundation the structure has
The type of construction of the structure
The exposure category of the RiskDesignCriteria as defined by the ASCE 7 Standard
The voltage of the utility being interconnected too
The phase of the utility being interconnected too

FeeStructure.description: A fee for a good or service

allOf.description: The type of fee period
The name of the fee payment
The ID of a particular fee
The uuid of the FeeStructure

Fee.description: A fee for a good or service

allOf.description: The name of the FeeStructure
The due date of a task
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Use the Value for the actual due date, start and end time can be used for the task start and completed dates

allOf.description: The state letters and GeoID as described by the Census FIPS code.

Answer.description: The result of an Checklist question

allOf.description: An ID for the Checklist question
The statement of the Checklist Question
The value of the Checklist Result
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Add units from the QuestionUnits Item Type. For Example, for a question that has an answer in Kilowatts, select QuestionUnits num:powerItemType, then add unit "Kilowatt" to the AnswerValue.

allOf.description: The ID of the transaction line
The type of Checklist
The ID of the transaction
The type of the Answer
The date of the Checklist
The type of result expected by the question
A valid value for an enumeration in a list
The phase of the interconnection

TariffStructure.description: The structure of a Tariff which is the sale of a commodity

allOf.description: The name of the Tariff
The ID of the Tariff
The type of Tariff
A currency amount
The units of the question
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Select ONLY items from the OB Item Type list for the expected answer unit type

allOf.description: The type of account
The name of the account
The account number
The role the account plays in the reporting systems

AgingBucket.description: Sum of the aging amounts of transactions for a particular time period

allOf.description: The number of past due days that the transactions are to be included in this aging bucket
The number of past due days that the transactions are to be included in this aging bucket
The type of aging bucket
The datasheet for the product
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: This is for a URL leading to the Datasheet for a product.

allOf.description: A single document in a collection of the instructions for a product.
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: This should be used for sending all of the instructions for installing and servicing the product. Each file can be placed in one member of the array of ProdInstructions

allOf.description: Use this for describing an individual specification
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Use this for custom units and details of the product

allOf.description: The enumerated list of the types of major specifications.
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: If the specification does not have a type listed here, select "None" and then use the SpecificationName as an alternative.

allOf.description: The specific unit of the specification
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: This needs to be the specific unit the SpecificationValue is given in

allOf.description: The value of the specific Specification.
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Note the unit always needs to be equal to the SpecificationUnit value

ProdSpecification.description: A single specification for a product

allOf.description: The name of the certification
The value of the certification

CertificationAgency.description: The agency or testing center that grants the certification

allOf.description: The name of the certification name
The aging balance from 1 to 30 days
Aging balance from 31 to 60 days
Aging balance from 61 to 90 days
Aging balance from 91 to 120 days
The aging balance over 120 days
The UUID of the task type
A wind speed
The design pressure to be applied to a structure for snow loading
The code for the local snow loading design
The message of the error

x-ob-sample-value.Value: Attempt to set field Site.PVSystems[0].EnergyPredictions[0].EnergyAC.StartTime to invalid date format. ISO date format expected. ( YYYY-MM-DD )

allOf.description: The name of the error
The code of an error
The number of days the jurisdiction on average takes to complete a permit

AHJInspection.description: An inspection conducted by the local AHJ

allOf.description: The name of the inspection
The notes about the inspection
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Used for instructions for carrying out the inspection

x-ob-sample-value.Value: Plan for Rough-In once racking is installed, call the morning of installation to schedule.

allOf.description: The method by which the permit is issued
The notes about the method of issuing permits the AHJ uses
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Used for instructions on receiving completed permits

x-ob-sample-value.Value: The permits are emailed to us with stamps and signatures. Print out the pdf and then send with the installation crew for the inspector.

allOf.description: The type of inspection
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Select from either the available common types, or choose other and attach the type in the description.

allOf.description: An option for the answer to a question
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Used for enumerated list values for selectable dropdown lists or multi-select questions

allOf.description: The UUID of the battery system
The price of the battery system as indicated on the contract
The length of the loan
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Use StartTime and EndTime in this object rather than Value for additional clarity. Use Value only if the Loan has no specific start or end time period

allOf.description: The percentage rate of the loan
The UUID of an object
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Always place this UUID at the top level of an object to which it refers. UUIDs are to be used for uniquely identifying objects that need to be repeatedly tracked across multiple softwares

allOf.description: The name of a TaskType
The UUID of the task category
The name of the task category which is used to normalize task types when searching across multiple companies.
The name of a FeeType
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Used to describe a general category of fees. This is a specific name for a fee. Whereas FeeGroup represents the normalized category of fee across multiple companies.

allOf.description: A optional normalized list of FeeTypes that allow for searching across multiple company datasets
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Use for a normalized list of possible Fees

allOf.description: If a on-site Technician from the AHJ is required to complete the AHJInspection
A quantity
The name of the service
The name of the person or organization providing the service

BillOfServices.description: The scope of work for the given context in which the object appears.

allOf.description: The status of the overall scope of work
The UUID of the service
The method by which the cost of a service is evaluated.
allOf.x-ob-usage-tips: Used in combination with the Quantity field. This provides the information required to calculate the cost of a given service.

allOf.description: The name of the service type
The UUID of the ServiceType
The optional list of normalized services that allow for cross-platform comparison of service data.
Information on who or what is performing the payment responsibility of the service
The Service Payment Responsibility for the Payee of the Service
The Service Payment Responsibility for the Payer of the Service
Amount Per ServiceQuantityUnit
The total amount of the individual line item calculated by multiplying Quantity by UnitPrice
An enumerated list of the possible certifications that a product can have.
Maximum AC Capacity or Load that the busbar is rated to handle.
Specific Details for a Combiner Panel product

num:areaItemType.description: The area item type is used to indicate that an element represents an area.

num:energyItemType.description: The energy item type represents a unit of energy.

MMBoe.label: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent
MMBoe.description: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

MMcfe.label: Million Cubic Foot Equivalent
MMcfe.description: Million cubic feet of natural gas equivalent

Bcfe.label: Billion Cubic Foot Equivalent
Bcfe.description: Thousand million cubic feet of natural gas equivalent

Tcfe.label: Trillion Cubic Foot Equivalent
Tcfe.description: Trillion cubic feet of natural gas equivalent

num:lengthItemType.description: The length item type is a measure of distance.

num:massItemType.description: The mass item type represents the mass of an object which can be measured.

lb.label: Pound
lb.description: Pound of Mass, as Used in Commerce (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pound_(mass)#Use_in_Commerce))

Gt.label: Gigatonne
Gt.description: Thousand Million Tonnes (Metric Tonnes, Metric Tons)

num:powerItemType.description: Measures a rate of energy use or energy production and is equivalent to the use or production of energy during a period of time. I.e. a watt is the equal to one joule of energy per second.

var.label: Volt-ampere reactive
var.description: In electric power transmission and distribution, volt-ampere reactive (var) is a unit by which reactive power is expressed in an AC electric power system. Reactive power is the power that is wasted and not used to do work on the load.

VA.label: Volt-ampere
VA.description: A volt-ampere (VA) is the unit used for the apparent power in an electrical circuit, equal to the product of root-mean-square (RMS) voltage and RMS current. In direct current (DC) circuits, this product is equal to the real power (active power) in watts. Volt-amperes are useful only in the context of alternating current (AC) circuits.

num:volumeItemType.description: The Volume item type is used to indicate that an element represents a volume and can be used to express the volume of any substance, whether solid, liquid, or gas.

aft.label: Acre-Foot
aft.description: Volume of one acre of surface area to a depth of one foot using a US survey foot

BMD.label: Bermuda Dollar
BMD.description: Bermudian dollar (customarily known as Bermuda dollar)

UYI.label: Uruguay Peso en Unidades Indexadas
UYI.description: Uruguay Peso en Unidades Indexadas (URUIURUI) (funds code)

XBC.label: E.U.A.-9
XBC.description: European Unit of Account 9 (E.U.A.-9) (bond market unit)

XBD.label: E.U.A.-17
XBD.description: European Unit of Account 17 (E.U.A.-17) (bond market unit)

num:memoryItemType.description: The memory item type is a measure of memory typically used in the IT industry.

B.label: Byte
B.description: 8 adjacent bits of Memory per IEEE 1541-2002

num-us:electricCurrentItemType.description: The electric current item type is used to represent a measure of electric current (the flow of electric charge over a circuit).

num-us:voltageItemType.description: The voltage item type is used to represent a measure of voltage (the difference in electric potential energy between two points per unit electric charge).

num-us:frequencyItemType.description: The frequency item type is used to represent a measure of the number of occurrences of a repeating event per unit time.

Hz.label: Hertz
Hz.description: Frequency or Number of Cycles per Second

perShareItemType.description: The per share item type indicates a monetary amount divided by a number of shares. The per share item type has a Decimal base.

Monetary_per_Monetary.label: Monetary/Monetary
Monetary_per_Monetary.description: Exchange Rate Expressed as: Monetary Unit / Monetary Unit

Y.label: Year
Y.description: Gregorian calendar year of 365 days. Use only as a denominator because durationItemType is not numeric and has no units.

M.label: Month
M.description: Gregorian calendar month of 30.41 days. Use only as a denominator because durationItemType is not numeric and has no units.

D.label: Day
D.description: Day of 24 hours. Use only as a denominator because durationItemType is not numeric and has no units.

H.label: Hour
H.description: Hour of 60 minutes. Use only as a denominator because durationItemType is not numeric and has no units.

MM.label: Minute
MM.description: Minute of 60 seconds. Use only as a denominator because durationItemType is not numeric and has no units.

S.label: Second
S.description: Second. Use only as a denominator because durationItemType is not numeric and has no units.

Q.label: Quarter
Q.description: Gregorian Calendar Quarter (three months). Use only as a denominator because durationItemType is not numeric and has no units.

WK.label: Week
WK.description: Gregorian Calendar Week. Use only as a denominator because durationItemType is not numeric and has no units.

flowItemType.description: The flow item type is used to represent a measure of volumetric flow rate.

Volume_per_Duration.label: Volume/Duration
Volume_per_Duration.description: Flow rate, as Volume per Duration

Energy_per_Duration.label: Energy/Duration
Energy_per_Duration.description: Flow rate, as Energy per Duration

num-us:temperatureItemType.description: The temperature item type is used to represent a measure of temperature either in absolute terms or as a difference between two temperatures.

Cel.label: Celsius
Cel.description: A temperature scale based on 0 for the freezing point of water and 100 for the boiling point of water at 1 atm pressure.

K.label: Kelvin
K.description: The kelvin is a unit of measure for temperature based upon an absolute scale. It is one of the seven base units in the International System of Units (SI) and is assigned the unit symbol K. The Kelvin scale is an absolute, thermodynamic temperature scale using as its null point absolute zero, the temperature at which all thermal motion ceases in the classical description of thermodynamics. The kelvin is defined as the fraction 1273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water (exactly 0.01 C or 32.018 F). In other words, it is defined such that the triple point of water is exactly 273.16 K.

F.label: Fahrenheit
F.description: Fahrenheit is a unit of measure for temperature defined by two fixed points: the temperature at which water freezes into ice is defined as 32 F, and the boiling point of water is defined to be 212 F, a 180 F separation, as defined at sea level and standard atmospheric pressure.

num-us:pressureItemType.description: The pressure item type is used to represent a measure of the force applied perpendicular to the surface of an object per unit area over which that force is distributed. Units include Pascal, PSI and Bar.

Pa.label: Pascal
Pa.description: The pascal is the SI derived unit of pressure used to quantify internal pressure, stress, Young's modulus and ultimate tensile strength. It is defined as one newton per square meter.

Bar.label: Bar
Bar.description: The bar is a metric unit of pressure, but is not approved as part of the International System of Units (SI). It is defined as exactly equal to 100000 Pa, which is slightly less than the current average atmospheric pressure on Earth at sea level.

psi.label: Pounds Per Square Inch
psi.description: The pound per square inch is a unit of pressure or of stress based on avoirdupois units. It is the pressure resulting from a force of one pound-force applied to an area of one square inch.

atm.label: Standard Atmosphere
atm.description: The standard atmosphere is a unit of pressure defined as 101325 Pa (1.01325 bar). It is sometimes used as a reference or standard pressure.

forceItemType.description: The force item type is used to represent a measure of a physical force.  Units include newtons.

N.label: Newton
N.description: The newton is the International System of Units (SI) derived unit of force. One newton is the force needed to accelerate one kilogram of mass at the rate of one metre per second squared in direction of the applied force.

electricChargeItemType.description: The electric charge item is used to represent a measure of electric charge (the physical property of matter that causes it to experience a force when placed in an electromagnetic field)

Ah.label: Ampere Hours
Ah.description: An ampere hour or amp hour is a unit of electric charge, equal to the charge transferred by a steady current of one ampere flowing for one hour.

C.label: Coulomb
C.description: The coulomb is the International System of Units (SI) unit of electric charge. It is the charge transported by a constant current of one ampere in one second.

num-us:planeAngleItemType.description: The angle item type is used to represent the measurement of an angle. Units include radians, degrees and gradians.

Degree.label: Degree
Degree.description: The degree is a measurement of a plane angle, defined so that a full rotation is 360 degrees. In XBRL the degree is reported in a decimal format.

rad.label: Radian
rad.description: The radian is the standard unit of angular measure. The radian is an SI derived unit.

textBlockItemType.description: textBlockItemType specializes xmlNodesItemType. The unescaped content MUST have mixed content containing a simple string, or a fragment of XHTML or a mixture of both.

num:percentItemType.description: The percent item type is used to indicate that the value of the element is intended to be presented as a percentage. This does not contravene Specification section 4.8.2, which requires that percentages not be multiplied by 100.

weightItemType.description: The weight item type represents the weight of an object which can be measured.

num-us:insolationItemType.description: The insolation item type is used to represent a measure of energy per area over a period of time.

num-us:irradianceItemType.description: The irradiance item type is used to represent a measure irradiance (power per unit area)

num-us:speedItemType.description: The speed item type is used to represent a measure of speed (distance travelled by an object per unit time). Units include knots, mach, and metres per second.

massFlowItemType.description: The mass flow item type is used to represent a measure of mass flow rate.

monetaryPerLengthItemType.description: The monetary per length item type is used to represent a measure of price or cost per unit length

monetaryPerAreaItemType.description: The monetary per area item type is used to represent a measure of price or cost per unit area

monetaryPerVolumeItemType.description: The monetary per volume item type is used to represent a measure of price or cost per unit volume

monetaryPerDurationItemType.description: The monetary per duration item type is used to represent a measure of price or cost per unit duration

monetaryPerEnergyItemType.description: The monetary per energy item type is used to represent a measure of price or cost per unit energy

monetaryPerMassItemType.description: The monetary per mass item type is used to represent a measure of price or cost per unit mass
